<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/ValidateCustomerCreditProfile/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_ValidateCustomerCreditProfile_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures related to Error information handling.</documentation> </annotation> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="Canonical_Error_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of an error in Canonical format. This should not be taken as an autonomous Error Object, as it is always to be contextualized within a Result Element. This object alone serves no other puirpose as to represent detailed outcome information regarding an particular execution of any capability/method/function.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="type" type="tns:CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Error Type. This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

Althought both attributes, module and subModule, are not correlative to any pre-defined structure or taxonomy, it is assumed that the subModule represents a component/attribute/member of the module. The subModule should not be sent if the module is ommitted. The module can be set without a subModule.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="module" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="subModule" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType"/> </complexType> <complexType name="SimpleEventPlaceHolderDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Minimum detail to be able to identify the place and time of a particular event.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="time" type="tns:messageTimeStamp_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="place" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMap_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key for each item.
The value is always of undertermined String type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Item" type="tns:StringDataMapItem_Type" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMapItem_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree item, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key.

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/GetAvailableProductOffer/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_GetAvailableProductOffer_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures related to Error information handling.</documentation> </annotation> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="Canonical_Error_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of an error in Canonical format. This should not be taken as an autonomous Error Object, as it is always to be contextualized within a Result Element. This object alone serves no other puirpose as to represent detailed outcome information regarding an particular execution of any capability/method/function.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="type" type="tns:CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Error Type. This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/MessageHeader/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/MessageHeader/v1" xmlns:esons_result="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" xmlns:esons_error="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateServiceRequest/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateServiceRequest_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures representing metadata related to a certain Service Operation Execution.</documentation> </annotation> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateServiceRequest/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateServiceRequest_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FResult_v2_ESO"/> <complexType name="MessageHeader_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It represents important metadata related to the execution of a certain service operation, during its original request, propagation and final response.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element ref="tns:Consumer"/> <element ref="tns:Trace"/> <element ref="tns:Channel" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="Consumer_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Information about the Service Consumer.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="sysCode" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique System Code. Represents the service consumer.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="enterpriseCode" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique Enterprise Code. Represents the enterprise service consumer.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="countryCode" type="eddns_dictionary:countryCode_SType" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique Country Code. Represents the Country from which the execution was made.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="Trace_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information related to traceability, which uniquely identifies this particular execution.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element ref="tns:Service" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Service that holds the control of the execution. This is expected to change each time a Service becomes statefull.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="clientReqTimestamp" use="required" type="eddns_dictionary:messageTimeStamp_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Represents the exact date-time when the consumer/client sent the message to the Service. This should be sent by Service Consumer, and never changed by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="reqTimestamp" type="eddns_dictionary:messageTimeStamp_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Represents the date-time when the request was taken by the Service. This should not be sent by a Service Consumer, but populated by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="rspTimestamp" type="eddns_dictionary:messageTimeStamp_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Represents the date-time when the response was delivered by the Service. This should not be sent by a Service Consumer, but populated by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="processID" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique process execution instance identifier. This should be sent by a Service Consumer, and never changed on the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="eventID" use="required" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique event execution instance identifier. This should be sent by a Service Consumer, and never changed on the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="sourceID" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Another level of detail to be used on-demand by service consumers, in compliance with any propouse they may see fit in each case. It should be sent by a Service Consumer, and never changed on the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="correlationEventID" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique EventyID correlation identifier, used to relate one execution to another. It should be sent by a Service Consumer, and never changed on the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="conversationID" type="tns:conversationID_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique correlation identifier, used to relate one execution to another. This should not be polulated by consumer, it is for internal use only.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="correlationID" type="tns:conversationID_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique correlation identifier, used to relate one excecution to another. This should not be polulated by consumer, it is for internal use only.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <simpleType name="conversationID_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique correlation identifier, used to relate one excecution to another. This should not be polulated by consumer, it is for internal use only.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"/> </simpleType> <complexType name="Channel_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds information about which channel is being used.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="name"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique Channel Code. Represents the channel being used.</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"/> </simpleType> </attribute> <attribute name="mode"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique channel Mode. Represents the mode on which the channel is being used.</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"/> </simpleType> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="Country_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Country from which a certain Service Operation is requested.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="code" type="int" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique Country Code. Represents the Country from which the execution was made.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="name" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Name of the Country.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="Service_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information about a Service, during a certain operation execution.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="code" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Unique Service Code. Represents the Service being requested. This should not be sent by a Service Consumer, but populated by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="name" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Name of the Service Being Requested. This should not be sent by a Service Consumer, but populated by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="operation" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Name of the Operation being requested for the Service. This should not be sent by a Service Consumer, but populated by the Requested Service.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="RequestHeader_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It represents important metadata related to the execution of a certain service operation, during its request.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:MessageHeader_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="esons_result:Result" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Result information associated with a Service request.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <complexType name="ResponseHeader_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It represents important metadata related to the execution of a certain service operation, during its response.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:MessageHeader_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="esons_result:Result"> <annotation> <documentation>Result information related to this response.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="RequestHeader" type="tns:RequestHeader_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It represents important metadata related to the execution of a certain service operation, during its request.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="ResponseHeader" type="tns:ResponseHeader_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It represents important metadata related to the execution of a certain service operation, during its response.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="Service" type="tns:Service_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information about a Service, during a certain operation execution.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="Consumer" type="tns:Consumer_Type"/> <element name="Channel" type="tns:Channel_Type"/> <element name="Trace" type="tns:Trace_Type"/> </schema>

<!--Ref EDD template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple and Basic data Structures, intented to be used across all the Inventory.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType name="SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the correlation between two things, with a simple framework of modules and subModules. Althought both attributes, module and subModule, are not correlative to any pre-defined structure or taxonomy, it is assumed that the subModule represents a component/attribute/member of the module. The subModule should not be sent if the module is ommitted. The module can be set without a subModule.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="module" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="subModule" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType"/> </complexType> <complexType name="SimpleEventPlaceHolderDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Minimum detail to be able to identify the place and time of a particular event.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="time" type="tns:messageTimeStamp_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="place" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMap_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key for each item.
The value is always of undertermined String type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Item" type="tns:StringDataMapItem_Type" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMapItem_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree item, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key.
The value is always of undertermined String type.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="key" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="value" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> </complexType> <complexType name="GenericDataMap_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key for each item.
The value is of undetermined type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Item" type="tns:GenericDataMapItem_Type" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="GenericDataMapItem_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree item, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key.
The value is of undetermined type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Value" type="anyType"/> </sequence> <attribute name="key" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType"/> </complexType> <simpleType name="messageTimeStamp_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for identifing a single timestamp of a particular message instance.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="dateTime"> <pattern value="[0-9]{4}-[01][0-9]-[0-3][0-9]T[0-2][0-9]:[0-5][0-9]:[0-6][0-9].*[0-9]*[0-9]*[0-9]*(Z|((\+|-)([0-1][0-2]|[0-0][0-9]):[0-5][0-9]))"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely identifing a System, Legacy, Application, etc..</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="countryCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely identifing a country.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="3"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="alphaCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Alphanumeric code represented by a 3 characters string.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="3"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="sysName_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely describing a instance of a System, Legacy, Application, etc.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="10"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple type used for values on which its representation is an undertermined string chain.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="age_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>It depicts the age of a person or object.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="id_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple type used for unique identifiers. This is represented in the integer base, and could apply the necessary restrictions given its representation.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="status_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="OK"/> <enumeration value="ERROR"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="timeout_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Generic Timeout values, made out of int values</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"> <!--Define future restrictions here.--> </restriction> </simpleType> <complexType name="Credentials_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Security related information, that allows a Consumer to access a certain service operation.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="user" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>The username being used for executing this service. Its mainly used for Security Constraints Validations.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="password" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>The password being used for executing this service. Its mainly used for Security Constraints Validations.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="CacheKey_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Key used to store cached values.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="source" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Component name to which the cached value is related.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="category" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Operation that belongs to the component, which is also related to the cached value.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="instance" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Instance, containing the information used to execute the operation related to the cached value.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="TimePeriod"> <annotation> <documentation>A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time, between two timepoints</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="endDateTime" type="dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod:</documentation> <documentation>Notes:</documentation> <documentation>If null, then represents to the end of time</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="startDateTime" type="dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod</documentation> <documentation>Notes:</documentation> <documentation>If null, then represents to the beginning of time</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="Money"> <annotation> <documentation>A base / value business entity used to represent money</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="amount" type="float" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>A positive floating point number.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="units" type="string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>Currency(Notes:refer to [ISO 4217]) or non-currency terms, such as loyalty points.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </complexType> </schema>

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" xmlns:esons_error="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateServiceRequest/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateServiceRequest_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FError_v1_ESO"/> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateServiceRequest/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateServiceRequest_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information related to a certain execution result.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType name="Result_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="esons_error:CanonicalError" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Representation of an unique non-successfull outcome status, if there is any. The Error modifier is applied as this element will be sent mainly on Error/Warning outcomes</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element ref="esons_error:SourceError" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Main Native Error associated with the Canonical Error, which was obtained by the use if the former.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="CorrelativeErrors" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Native Errors correlative with the main Source Error, that may be included for trace purposes.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType> <sequence> <element ref="esons_error:SourceError" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="status" use="required" type="tns:resultStatus_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Result status of the Execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Non-Technical Information related to this particular result.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <simpleType name="resultStatus_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="OK"/> <enumeration value="WARNING"/> <enumeration value="ERROR"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <element name="Result" type="tns:Result_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information related to a certain execution result.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </schema>

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateServiceRequest/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateServiceRequest_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures related to Error information handling.</documentation> </annotation> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="Canonical_Error_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of an error in Canonical format. This should not be taken as an autonomous Error Object, as it is always to be contextualized within a Result Element. This object alone serves no other puirpose as to represent detailed outcome information regarding an particular execution of any capability/method/function.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="type" type="tns:CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Error Type. This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateProductOrder/v1?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateProductOrder_v1%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures related to Error information handling.</documentation> </annotation> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="Canonical_Error_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of an error in Canonical format. This should not be taken as an autonomous Error Object, as it is always to be contextualized within a Result Element. This object alone serves no other puirpose as to represent detailed outcome information regarding an particular execution of any capability/method/function.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="type" type="tns:CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Error Type. This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

<!--Ref EDD template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple and Basic data Structures, intented to be used across all the Inventory.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType name="SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the correlation between two things, with a simple framework of modules and subModules. Althought both attributes, module and subModule, are not correlative to any pre-defined structure or taxonomy, it is assumed that the subModule represents a component/attribute/member of the module. The subModule should not be sent if the module is ommitted. The module can be set without a subModule.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="module" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="subModule" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType"/> </complexType> <complexType name="SimpleEventPlaceHolderDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Minimum detail to be able to identify the place and time of a particular event.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="time" type="tns:messageTimeStamp_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="place" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMap_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key for each item.
The value is always of undertermined String type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Item" type="tns:StringDataMapItem_Type" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="StringDataMapItem_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree item, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key.
The value is always of undertermined String type.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="key" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> <attribute name="value" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType" use="required"/> </complexType> <complexType name="GenericDataMap_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key for each item.
The value is of undetermined type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Item" type="tns:GenericDataMapItem_Type" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="GenericDataMapItem_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Data Structure representing a map-like tree item, on which a single value is assosiated with a single key.
The value is of undetermined type.</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="Value" type="anyType"/> </sequence> <attribute name="key" type="tns:genericStringValue_SType"/> </complexType> <simpleType name="messageTimeStamp_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for identifing a single timestamp of a particular message instance.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="dateTime"> <pattern value="[0-9]{4}-[01][0-9]-[0-3][0-9]T[0-2][0-9]:[0-5][0-9]:[0-6][0-9].*[0-9]*[0-9]*[0-9]*(Z|((\+|-)([0-1][0-2]|[0-0][0-9]):[0-5][0-9]))"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely identifing a System, Legacy, Application, etc..</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="countryCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely identifing a country.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="3"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="alphaCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Alphanumeric code represented by a 3 characters string.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="3"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="sysName_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for univoquely describing a instance of a System, Legacy, Application, etc.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <length value="10"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple type used for values on which its representation is an undertermined string chain.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="age_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>It depicts the age of a person or object.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="id_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Simple type used for unique identifiers. This is represented in the integer base, and could apply the necessary restrictions given its representation.</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"/> </simpleType> <simpleType name="status_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="OK"/> <enumeration value="ERROR"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="timeout_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Generic Timeout values, made out of int values</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="int"> <!--Define future restrictions here.--> </restriction> </simpleType> <complexType name="Credentials_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Security related information, that allows a Consumer to access a certain service operation.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="user" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>The username being used for executing this service. Its mainly used for Security Constraints Validations.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="password" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>The password being used for executing this service. Its mainly used for Security Constraints Validations.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="CacheKey_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Key used to store cached values.</documentation> </annotation> <attribute name="source" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Component name to which the cached value is related.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="category" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Operation that belongs to the component, which is also related to the cached value.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="instance" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Instance, containing the information used to execute the operation related to the cached value.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <complexType name="TimePeriod"> <annotation> <documentation>A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time, between two timepoints</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="endDateTime" type="dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod:</documentation> <documentation>Notes:</documentation> <documentation>If null, then represents to the end of time</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="startDateTime" type="dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod</documentation> <documentation>Notes:</documentation> <documentation>If null, then represents to the beginning of time</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="Money"> <annotation> <documentation>A base / value business entity used to represent money</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="amount" type="float" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>A positive floating point number.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="units" type="string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>Currency(Notes:refer to [ISO 4217]) or non-currency terms,
