<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Result/v2" xmlns:esons_error="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateOneClickToOrder/v2?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateOneClickToOrder_v2%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FError_v1_ESO"/> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateOneClickToOrder/v2?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateOneClickToOrder_v2%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information related to a certain execution result.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType name="Result_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="esons_error:CanonicalError" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Representation of an unique non-successfull outcome status, if there is any. The Error modifier is applied as this element will be sent mainly on Error/Warning outcomes</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element ref="esons_error:SourceError" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Main Native Error associated with the Canonical Error, which was obtained by the use if the former.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="CorrelativeErrors" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Native Errors correlative with the main Source Error, that may be included for trace purposes.</documentation> </annotation> <complexType> <sequence> <element ref="esons_error:SourceError" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="status" use="required" type="tns:resultStatus_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Result status of the Execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Non-Technical Information related to this particular result.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <simpleType name="resultStatus_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="OK"/> <enumeration value="WARNING"/> <enumeration value="ERROR"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <element name="Result" type="tns:Result_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>Meta-Information related to a certain execution result.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </schema>

<!--Ref ESO template: v1.0 - NO BORRAR--> <schema targetNamespace="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://www.entel.cl/ESO/Error/v1" xmlns:eddns_dictionary="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1"> <import namespace="http://www.entel.cl/EDD/Dictionary/v1" schemaLocation="http://10.84.13.72:7010/ES/CreateOneClickToOrder/v2?SCHEMA%2FES_CreateOneClickToOrder_v2%2FExposition%2FContract%2FPrimary%2FESH%2FDictionary_v1_EDD"/> <annotation> <documentation>Data structures related to Error information handling.</documentation> </annotation> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="Canonical_Error_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of an error in Canonical format. This should not be taken as an autonomous Error Object, as it is always to be contextualized within a Result Element. This object alone serves no other puirpose as to represent detailed outcome information regarding an particular execution of any capability/method/function.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="type" type="tns:CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Canonical Error Type. This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource. It is used to increase the level of specificity to be considered for Error Translation within the ErrorManager. This element is completely optional, as this level of detail is not mandatory for sucessfull error translation.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> </schema>

This element can change during the error interpretation process, within each service execution.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="CanonicalError" type="tns:Canonical_Error_Type"/> <simpleType name="CanonicalErrorType_SType"> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="NEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="DAT"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al Proveedor de Datos, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="TEC"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el proveedor de datos (Unexpected Errors).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="UNK"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="SEG"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWNE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error relacionada a negocio (Expected Error).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWDA"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la existencia de un error originado por: formato de datos, obligatoriedad validacin de la estructura del mensaje no corresponde con el contrato de servicio, ya sea en la peticin enviada al servicio consumidor, como en la respuesta obtenida del mismo.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWTE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la presencia de un error de naturaleza tcnica en el framework (Unexpected Errors): No disponibilidad. Error en la comunicacin, (por ejemplo: timeouts). Otros errores propios del sistema productor de datos.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWUN"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error que no identificado (mapeado).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWSE"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado al mbito de la seguridad (Unexpected Error), Validacin de credenciales. Permisos de ejecucin.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> <enumeration value="FWCF"> <annotation> <documentation>Indica la ocurrencia de un error relacionado a la configuracion (inconsistente).</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorMetadata_Type"> <attribute name="code" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="description" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>Error Description. There may be no description if the error is represented in a non-canonical form, but this element should be populated if its on the canonical form.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorMetadata" type="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="ErrorSourceDetails_Type"> <attribute name="source" type="eddns_dictionary:sysCode_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source. It depicts the source of an associated error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This should be a known System Code.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="details" type="eddns_dictionary:genericStringValue_SType"> <annotation> <documentation>An error Source Details. It depicts the original source detailes of an associated Error, as described by the component that handled it in each case. This data should not be restricted to a known code, as it is descriptive information.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> <element name="ErrorSourceDetails" type="tns:ErrorSourceDetails_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <complexType name="SourceError_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It holds the information of error in non-canonical format, with its associated information.</documentation> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="tns:ErrorMetadata_Type"> <sequence> <element ref="tns:ErrorSourceDetails" minOccurs="1"/> <element name="SourceFault" type="anyType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Source Fault Message. This can be an exception, an controlled message, etc. This should represent where the ErrorMetadata was interpreted from, and it should be provided by the Source described on the ErrorSourceDetails. Its an optional element, and should be used only when this type of information can be shown and when it is neccesary.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <element name="SourceError" type="tns:SourceError_Type"/> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <!--******************************************************************************************************************************************************************--> <element name="ErrorIndex" type="eddns_dictionary:SimpleIndexDetail_Type"> <annotation> <documentation>It allows the specific indexation of an error to a certain context or resource.
